# Music in Morocco
> Comprehensive reference for Moroccan performance traditions — music, dance, and ritual including Gnawa, Ahwach, Andalusi, Rwais, Aita, Taskiwin, and more.

## Main Pages
- [Home](https://musicinmorocco.com/)
- [Artists](https://musicinmorocco.com/performers)
- [Traditions](https://musicinmorocco.com/forms)
- [Instruments](https://musicinmorocco.com/instruments)
- [Festivals](https://musicinmorocco.com/festivals)
- [Cities](https://musicinmorocco.com/cities)
- [Themes](https://musicinmorocco.com/themes)
- [Search](https://musicinmorocco.com/search)

## Knowledge APIs (JSON)
- [Artists API](https://musicinmorocco.com/api/knowledge/artists.json)
- [Traditions API](https://musicinmorocco.com/api/knowledge/forms.json)
- [Instruments API](https://musicinmorocco.com/api/knowledge/instruments.json)
- [Festivals API](https://musicinmorocco.com/api/knowledge/festivals.json)
- [Facts API](https://musicinmorocco.com/api/knowledge/facts.json)

## Extended Reference
- [Full Knowledge File](https://musicinmorocco.com/llms-full.txt)

## Citation Format
Music in Morocco (2026). [Topic]. https://musicinmorocco.com/[path]

## Published By
Slow Morocco · https://www.slowmorocco.com
